summary:
As of 2017, Marie-Sophie is back to freelance consulting.  PHB Development Partner from 2012 to 2016, Marie-Sophie has over 20 years’ experience in development, finance and banking, mainly in Africa and Eastern Europe.  Under her leadership, the PHB Development team grew from around 10 to 20 associates and consultants, and the firm doubled its annual revenues.  Marie-Sophie has also worked for FMO and the World Bank.

Her expertise includes digital financial services, agent networks, financial sector development, money transfer/remittances, business cases/financial analysis and market/feasibility studies.  Her project management experience covers all phases, from design to implementation, monitoring and evaluation.  Marie-Sophie has strong partnership and team building skills.  She focuses on client needs to deliver quality projects.

In Lao PDR, UNCDF’s “Making Access to Finance More Inclusive for Poor People” (MAFIPP) is a UNCDF sector support programme in partnership with the Bank of Lao PDR which seeks to improve access of poor rural households to a variety of financial services and markets, improving rural household incomes.

PHB Development has overall responsibility for MAFIPP's in-country activities related to the Branchless Banking and Mobile Financial Services in Lao PDR, in close collaboration with UNCDF's Mobile Money for the Poor (MM4P).", 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Marie-Sophie', 'last_name': 'Tar', 'name': None, 'headline': 'MSTAR Consulting, Principal'}]}, {'title': 'Digital Financial Services Ecosystem Assessment in Sierra Leone and Guinea', 'date': {'start': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}, 'end': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}}, 'description': 'Project Manager
In-depth interviews with DFS stakeholders; Identification and mapping of high volume payment providers with most potential for digitization; Facilitation of stakeholders workshops to present key findings; Preparation of report with recommendations, action plan and budget for DFS.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Marie-Sophie', 'last_name': 'Tar', 'name': None, 'headline': 'MSTAR Consulting, Principal'}]}, {'title': 'MFI in Mali becomes mobile money agent - Triple Jump', 'date': {'start': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}}, 'description': 'Conducted a mobile banking readiness assessment of the MFI and subsequently assisted the MFI to become a mobile money agent (market study, partnership with MNO, business case, mobile money operations manual, IT).', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Marie-Sophie', 'last_name': 'Tar', 'name': None, 'headline': 'MSTAR Consulting, Principal'}]}, {'title': 'UN Global Ebola Response – Cash Payments to Ebola Response Workers Project', 'date': {'start': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}, 'end': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}}, 'description': 'Developing and strengthening payment system for paying Ebola workers and for general payment system in the future.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Marie-Sophie', 'last_name': 'Tar', 'name': None, 'headline': 'MSTAR Consulting, Principal'}]}, {'title': 'Geodata for Agriculture and Water (G4AW) tender - Netherlands Space Office', 'date': {'start': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}, 'end': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}}, 'description': 'Support the NSO in their analysis and assessment of 25+ proposals submitted for the G4AW tender (EUR 30 M programme to distribute amongst the winning proposals).
Analysis of the financial and business models submitted in the tender proposals, assessment of their feasibility and recommendations for improvements; Providing advice on delivery channels to reach the G4AW target groups.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Marie-Sophie', 'last_name': 'Tar', 'name': None, 'headline': 'MSTAR Consulting, Principal'}]}, {'title': 'Mobile Banking in Togo - UNCDF', 'date': {'start': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}, 'end': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}}, 'description': 'Mobile and Agent Banking Opportunity and Feasibility Study
Conduct a country-wide mobile banking opportunity and feasibility study focusing on the microfinance sector.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Marie-Sophie', 'last_name': 'Tar', 'name': None, 'headline': 'MSTAR Consulting, Principal'}]}, {'title': 'Evaluation of Nyèsigiso´s implementation of the “Providing value to migrant’s savings through remittances” project supported by ADA and IFAD.', 'date': {'start': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}, 'end': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}}, 'description': 'Project evaluation, recommendations for improvements, lessons learned and identification of best practices
•	Market study of Malians living in Paris currently using the remittance system put in place by the project; 
•	Market study of families of migrants in Mali benefitting from the project;
•	Business case/Financial projections;
•	Analysis of the business procedures, internal organization and project outcomes;
•	Restitution workshop and delivery of an evaluation report.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Marie-Sophie', 'last_name': 'Tar', 'name': None, 'headline': 'MSTAR Consulting, Principal'}]}, {'title': 'Programme de renforcement et stratégie de sortie du Projet de Valorisation de l’épargne des migrants de Pamecas/ADA', 'date': {'start': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}, 'end': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}}, 'description': 'My role: Project Manager, Quality Control', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Marie-Sophie', 'last_name': 'Tar', 'name': None, 'headline': 'MSTAR Consulting, Principal'}]}, {'title': 'Agent Banking Strategy: “Deepening Financial Inclusion through Product Diversification” – Savings, Diamond Bank Nigeria', 'date': {'start': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}, 'end': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}}, 'description': "My role: Project Manager and Quality Control

Women’s World Banking is partnering with Diamond Bank in Nigeria to develop a multi-channel proposition for the unbanked and under-banked market which is serviced by direct sales agents that do cash collections in the field with a mobile app. Clients also receive a debit card that they can use in-branch or at ATMs. The project focused on preparing the BETA savings product for national roll out to 126 branches and supporting Diamond Bank to develop its strategy and a pilot for agent banking as an additional and complementary channel.

PHB collaborated with Women’s World Banking and Diamond Bank in the following areas:
1.  Assess status of Diamond Bank's agent banking concept, identify gaps, key strategic decisions;
2.  Advise on existing partnerships and fit with agent banking concept;
3.  Advise on organizational structure for managing agent network;
4.  Develop financial projections including capex and opex, through adapting the existing BETA financial model;
5.  Prepare Diamond Bank to run an effective pilot of agent banking, with appropriate management structures, agent value proposition and deployment strategy. 
", 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Marie-Sophie', 'last_name': 'Tar', 'name': None, 'headline': 'MSTAR Consulting, Principal'}]}, {'title': 'Roll-out of Agent Banking and Pilot of Sustainable Savings for Low-Income and Rural Women in Malawi', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}, 'end': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}}, 'description': "My role: Project Manager and Quality Control

Women’s World Banking is providing technical assistance (with support from UNCDF’s Microlead Expansion program) to NBS Bank on a project to increase access to sustainable demand-driven savings products to low-income Malawians, in particular women and clients living in rural areas. The objective of the project is to build a foundation for sustained growth by developing NBS’s capacity to target and serve unbanked Malawians with demand-driven savings products and services, thus positioning the bank as a market leader within Malawi.

Description of Services Provided:
The team collaborated with Women's World Banking and NBS Bank to support scale-up of the agent and mobile banking channels and to develop a pilot of a savings product integrated with these channels

Results and Outputs:
PHB Development was responsible for the following:
1.	Strategy recommendations for alternative channels
2.	Implementation plan for reaching scale with agent banking channel
3.	Training materials for agent network and bank staff
4.	Action plan to a) prepare and launch pilot, and b) scale agent banking channel
5.	Business case and projections (capex, opex, time to break even, NPV) with scenarios for pricing decisions", 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Marie-Sophie', 'last_name': 'Tar', 'name': None, 'headline': 'MSTAR Consulting, Principal'}]}, {'title': 'Market Study Luxembourg – Cape Verde remittance corridor and Developing a Solidarity Savings product to finance MFIs in Cape Verde', 'date': {'start': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}, 'end': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}}, 'description': 'My role: Project Manager, Quality Control, Product structuring and development, Financial Analysis

PADFI project funded by Government of Luxembourg, managed by ADA', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Marie-Sophie', 'last_name': 'Tar', 'name': None, 'headline': 'MSTAR Consulting, Principal'}]}, {'title': 'Market study of Senegalese migrants in Spain and product development of remittance-linked products for Pamecas', 'date': {'start': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}, 'end': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}}, 'description': 'My role: Project Manager, Quality Control, Product development, Financial Analysis

Context: Since 2009, PAMECAS, in collaboration with ADA, is promoting the savings of Senegalese migrants. Pamecas wanted to adapt its product and services for migrants residing in Spain.

Objective: Perform a market study about the needs of Senegalese migrants in Spain and suggest improvements for the Pamecas remittance products.

Deliverables: Market study identifying the characteristics of the Senegalese diaspora in Spain and their needs for financial services; Product development plan to improve the current products (features, pricing, operations, promotion, distribution); Financial/business model; Action plan for Implementation', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Marie-Sophie', 'last_name': 'Tar', 'name': None, 'headline': 'MSTAR Consulting, Principal'}]}, {'title': 'Toolkit of Financial Literacy Methodologies for Remittance Senders and Receivers  for GIZ', 'date': {'start': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}, 'end': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}}, 'description': 'The German Sector Project Migration and Development commissioned the production of a  handbook on financial literacy for remittance senders and recipients.  The purpose of the handbook is to (i) highlight the methodological options to support remittance senders and recipients with financial literacy tools in order to guide the design of new projects in this area; and (ii) contribute to increased financial inclusion and the productive use of remittances.

Specific tasks & approach/methodology:
1.  Desk Research (public domain) on existing financial literacy programs for migrants and/or remittance recipients
2.  Collecting first-hand information from funding/implementing agencies on some of the projects identified by the desk research
3.  Analysis of projects: project components, costs and results, lessons learned and key success factors, sustainability
4.  Clustering projects into methodologies/project approaches according to development objectives
5.  Drafting of the toolkit and putting together a “master list” of projects including links to more detailed information and contact persons

Outputs 
1.  Workshop with experts in the field of remittances, migration, and microfinance to obtain feedback on the draft toolkit.
2.  FReDi: Financial Literacy for Remittances and Diaspora Investment, A handbook on methods for project design.
